alert.note: Alert for Craig; Delaware; Mayes; Rogers (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 8:06AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Craig, central Rogers, northwestern Delaware and Mayes Counties through 845 AM CDT... At 806 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles east of Chelsea to 6 miles east of Foyil to 2 miles south of Claremore. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Claremore... Pryor... Pryor Creek... Verdigris... Chouteau... Chelsea... Inola... Salina... Langley... Adair... Ketchum... Spavinaw... Foyil... Disney... Big Cabin... Pensacola... Hoot Owl... Cherokee State Park... Cleora... Spavinaw State Park... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 241 and 280. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
